sub_title: Doctoral student at the University of Helsinki | Scholar of American Studies and history | Writer | Photographer
summary:
I am an internationally oriented storyteller with ambitions to develop myself further as a researcher, a journalist, and an author. Through a combination of creativity and analysis, I continuously try to improve my understanding of the world and bring others along on that journey. At the moment, I am putting my passions for research and writing to use as a doctoral student at the University of Helsinki. My dissertation project concerns the role of music in United States boarding schools for Native American children in the 19th and 20th centuries.

During my time as a student of American Studies and History at Radboud University in Nijmegen, I became acquainted with the different ways of conveying a story, from academic publications and journalistic articles to literature and photography. I switch effortlessly between Dutch and English, and time spent living in the United States has made me culturally versatile as well. In addition, my role as a member of various (editorial) boards and committees has taught me to work in a team, exercise leadership, and above all to be open to new challenges.

projects.title: 19th Maple Leaf and Eagle Conference
projects.description: I was a member of the organizing committee for the Maple Leaf and Eagle, the University of Helsinki's biennial North American Studies conference. Along with the rest of the committee, I helped create the three-day program and also assisted with website management. In addition, I chaired a panel on "Education and Conceptions of History" during the conference itself.

projects.title: Tijdschrift De Focus
projects.description: Publicatie van een populairwetenschappelijk tijdschrift met daarin een selectie van de beste artikelen die de afgelopen vijf jaar op de website van journalistiek platform De Focus zijn verschenen.

contributors.headline: Doctoral student at the University of Helsinki | Scholar of American Studies and history | Writer | Photographer

projects.title: Study Trip Tallinn
projects.description: Headed USA Nijmegen's travel committee for organizing this year's study trip, to Tallinn, Estonia. With a team of five students, we put together and arranged a program that would give participating members an experience that was fun, but above all academically relevant. The trip included a meeting with the Dutch Ambassador, an exploration of the history of Estonia under Soviet occupation and even a visit to the American Studies department at the university of Helsinki.

authors.headline: Doctoral student at the University of Helsinki | Scholar of American Studies and history | Writer | Photographer

profile_positions.description: As a salaried doctoral researcher, I receive support from the University of Helsinki to conduct my dissertation research on uses of marching band music at government-run boarding schools for Native American children in the United States at the turn of the twentieth century.
profile_positions.title: Doctoral Candidate

profile_positions.description: As research assistant for the research group HUMANA at the University of Helsinki, it was my task to collect data from historical deed and tax records. This information could then used by my supervisors to conduct social network analysis on Finnish migration to the United States and socio-demographic developments on Sugar Island, Michigan.
profile_positions.title: Research assistant

profile_positions.description:
The Netherlands American Studies Review showcases essays by talented students of North American Studies in the Netherlands. 
- As editor, I help authors improve their essays and make them suited for publication.
- Meetings with the board to discuss the contents of the journal and select submissions that we want to publish.
profile_positions.title: Editor NASA Review

profile_positions.description:
In addition to writing and editing for student magazine ANS, I have also done a range of photo assignments. 
- Photographs accompanying interviews and background articles.
- Photo reports for the magazine's website, covering subjects like the Four Day Marches and the renovation of Nijmegen's river front in 2019.
profile_positions.title: Photographer

profile_positions.description:
After my time as editor-in-chief, I stayed active at student magazine ANS, for instance writing articles on the following: 
- The history of privacy on the internet. 
- Student participation in a protest organized by Extinction Rebellion. 
- In addition, I reviewed books, articles and exhibitions for the ANS-Online website.
profile_positions.title: Staff writer

profile_positions.description: Member of Algemeen Nijmegen Studentenblad's advisory council, which provides the editorial board with feedback and suggestions on both the magazine and website.
profile_positions.title: Member of the advisory council

profile_positions.description:
As one of two editors for ANS (Radboud University’s independent student-run magazine), I was in charge of ANS-Online, a website that publishes news articles and long-reads relevant to students living and studying in Nijmegen.
- Covering news events at Radboud University, in Nijmegen and in higher education nationally. 
- Coming up with ideas for in-depth articles and reports for both the website and the magazine.
- Responsibility for the website’s design and lay-out using Joomla. 
- Leading an editorial board of four with my fellow editor-in-chief, and overseeing a network of staff writers and photographers. 
- In addition, I took the initiative to translate articles relevant to international students into English with the support of a team of student translators.
profile_positions.title: Editor-in-chief ANS-Online

profile_positions.description:
As a student assistent to Dr. Mathilde Roza, I am helping to set up a research project to identify Indigenous members of the American and Canadian armies that participated in Operation Market Garden and the liberation of Nijmegen during the Second World War.
- Using digitized sources available online to identify individual soldiers and learn more about their stories and experiences during the war.
- Supervising a group of students working on this project as part of the master's program in Transatlantic Studies.
- Creating a website in Wordpress to present findings from the project.
profile_positions.title: Student assistent 'Operation Turtle'

profile_positions.description: At De Focus, I was responsible for the final steps in the editing process and the publication of new articles on our website, which helps students find a wide audience for their thesis research. In addition to the website's lay-out, I was responsible for sharing these publications on social media. Finally, I helped organize workshops on academic outreach for students from different Dutch universities.
profile_positions.title: Copy editor

profile_positions.description: As a research assistent for Prof. dr. Jan Hein Furnée, I used the digitized population registry on the website of the Amsterdam City Archives to find missing information on the Amsterdam electorate in 1853.
profile_positions.title: Student assistent

profile_positions.description: As a member of the Advisory Board, I provided the board with advice on policy documents and other issues within the study association.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Advisory Board

profile_positions.description: Author of various articles on American politics and culture as a contributor for USA Nijmegen's quarterly magazine, The Issue.
profile_positions.title: Writer for The Issue

profile_positions.description:
Member on the board of the study association for American Studies in Nijmegen.
- Writing creative texts about upcoming activities for the bi-weekly newsletter. 
- Contact with students and other members of the association, as well as with staff and faculty. 
- Running the official website using Wordpress. 
- Taking notes during meetings with the board and general assemblies.
profile_positions.title: Secretary

profile_positions.description:
- As the head of the study association's travel committee, I was in charge of organizing a one-week study trip to Tallinn (Estonia) relevant to the American Studies program. 
- During the trip, we visited the Dutch embassy, did a city tour about the city's Cold War past, and embarked on a day trip to the University of Helsinki.
profile_positions.title: Head of the Travel Committee

profile_positions.description:
- I was a reporter at the State and National Desk of local newspaper The Daily Tar Heel during my exchange semester at the University of North Carolina in Chapel Hill.
- Reported on issues ranging from airport security and solar energy to the 2016 presidential election.
- Interviewing sources over the phone and on-site reporting, for instance during campaign events.
profile_positions.title: Staff writer
